attributes.action: Educate people about using their left indicators when coming OFF of roundabouts, or make it law.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I can't believe the amount of time cars are lined up at roundabouts unnecessarily because the traffic that is pealing off at the previous exit does not indicate that it is doing so.
As these cars have not done so, it would be ill-advised and foolhardy for drivers to enter the roundabout - so, they wait.
It might also be worth explaining to people that, when they are on the inside lane of a roundabout, they cannot automatically move into the left lane as they come off of it (onto a dual carriageway, say) as this blocks the lane for traffic adjacent to it (negating the whole point of the roundabout) and reduces traffic flow.
Simple, simple stuff, yet no-one seems to get it - perhaps a public information advert could clear this up and help us all to get home at night.

rejection.details: This is already done through the Highway Code
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
